meanings.definition: To convert a message into a coded form.
meanings.sent1: She recoded the secret message to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: The spy recoded the important document for security reasons.
meanings.sent3: The detective recoded the clue to outsmart the criminal.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were recoded into a complex cipher.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll was recoded to protect its contents.

meanings.definition: To alter or revise a piece of information.
meanings.sent1: He recoded the error in the report before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher recoded the grades after discovering a mistake.
meanings.sent3: The comedian recoded the punchline for a better reaction.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were recoded with new details over time.
meanings.sent5: The artist recoded the painting to enhance its beauty.

meanings.definition: To change the format or structure of data.
meanings.sent1: The programmer recoded the software for better performance.
meanings.sent2: They recoded the website to make it more user-friendly.
meanings.sent3: The chef recoded the recipe to simplify the cooking process.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was recoded by the glowing lights at night.
meanings.sent5: The architect recoded the blueprint to improve the building design.
